info.title: GenHMS API
info.description:
This document provides the GenHMS Backend REST API interface. Test Server for GenHMS Backend REST API. https://hms.genyazilim.com/api Document Change Log | Published Date | Document Version Number | Description of Revision | |-------------------|---------------------------|---------------------------------| | 16.08.2023 | v1.0.1 | Claimer Endpoints Added | | 12.04.2023 | v1.0.0 | Initial Pre-Alpha.
|

post.description: This endpoint SendsRequest relative insurance endpoint and creates Fhir Coverage Resource.
This endpoint SendsRequest relative insurance endpoint and creates Fhir CoverageEligibilityResponse Resource.

post.summary: Consumes Claim Resource Creates ClaimResponse Resource
post.description: This endpoint SendsRequest relative insurance endpoint and creates Fhir ClaimResponse Resource.

post.summary: Sends an e-Archive invoice by compressing the provided XML invoice file and submitting it to the e-Archive system.
post.description: This endpoint accepts a SendEArchiveInvoice object which contains the path to the XML invoice file. The invoice file is then compressed, and the resulting e-Archive invoice is submitted to the e-Archive system. If the process is successful, a confirmation is returned.

get.summary: Retrieves the tax payer status for a given VAT Identification Number (VKN).

parameters.name: vkn
parameters.description: The VAT Identification Number of the taxpayer.

post.summary: Creates an invoice with the given invoice ID.
post.description:
This method is responsible for creating an invoice based on the provided invoiceId.
It uses various services and libraries to generate an HTML representation of the invoice,
convert it to PDF, upload both HTML and PDF versions to a storage system,
and update the invoice resource with a shared link to the PDF.

post.summary: Sends an invoice to the specified receiver.
post.description:
This API endpoint takes a SendInvoice object as input, which includes the invoice path, sender and receiver information.
The invoice XML file is compressed and sent to the receiver via the Izibiz service.

post.summary: Sends an invoice response with server-side signing.
post.description:
This API endpoint takes a SendInvoiceResponseModel object and sends an invoice response
using the e-Invoice web service with server-side signing. It returns the result of the operation.

requestBody.description: The SendInvoiceResponseModel object containing the necessary information to send the invoice response.

post.summary: This endpoint gets Task information from FHIR and sends a SOAP request to E-Nabız system.
post.description: The Task must be an E-Nabız 101 task.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The id of the Task that is saved on FHIR.

get.summary: Retrieves an invoice using the FHIR invoice ID and generates an invoice XML document.
get.description: This API endpoint takes a FHIR Invoice ID as input, retrieves the corresponding FHIR Invoice resource, and generates an invoice XML document based on the retrieved information. The generated XML document can be used for further processing or transmission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The FHIR Invoice ID used to retrieve the ESmm.

get.summary: Retrieves an invoice using the FHIR invoice ID and generates an invoice XML document.
get.description: This API endpoint takes a FHIR Invoice ID as input, retrieves the corresponding FHIR Invoice resource, and generates an invoice XML document based on the retrieved information. The generated XML document can be used for further processing or transmission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The FHIR Invoice ID used to retrieve the ESmm.

post.summary: Sends an e-SMM (e-Serbest Meslek Makbuzu) by providing the necessary information.
post.description: This method compresses the XML file at the given path and sends it using the SendSmmRequest.

requestBody.description: An instance of SendEsmm containing the XML file path to be sent.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of all available S3 buckets.
get.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of all available S3 buckets.

put.summary: Creates a new S3 bucket with the specified name.
put.description: This endpoint creates a new S3 bucket with the specified name.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the new bucket to create.

delete.description: This endpoint deletes the specified S3 bucket.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket to delete.

get.summary: Gets a shared link for the specified object in the specified S3 bucket.
get.description: The endpoint is used to generate a shared link for a specified object in an S3 bucket.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The Key of the object to generate a shared link for.

put.summary: Uploads a new file to the specified S3 bucket.
put.description:
This endpoint allows for the upload of a new file to the specified S3 bucket. 
The file to upload is provided in the request body as an instance of the UploadFileModel class. 
Additionally, metadata can be provided as a header parameter with key "meta".

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to additional metadata Example values;
Content-Writer,
Project-Name,
OTHER

put.summary: Uploads a new file to the specified S3 bucket, returns shared link uploaded file.
put.description:
This endpoint allows for the upload of a new file to the specified S3 bucket. 
The file to upload is provided in the request body as an instance of the UploadFileModel class. 
Additionally, metadata can be provided as a header parameter with key "meta".

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to additional metadata Example values;
Content-Writer,
Project-Name,
OTHER

get.summary: Gets a file from the specified S3 bucket.
get.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a file from a specific S3 bucket.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The Key of the file to get.

delete.summary: Deletes a file with the specified Key from the specified bucket.
delete.description: This endpoint deletes a file with the specified key from the specified Amazon S3 bucket.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the file.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The Key identifying the file within the bucket.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of objects in the specified MinIO S3 bucket with the specified prefix.
get.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of objects from an Amazon S3 bucket that match the specified prefix. The prefix parameter is used to filter the objects to retrieve.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket to retrieve objects from.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The prefix used to filter the objects to retrieve.

200.description: Returns the list of objects in the specified bucket with the specified prefix.

404.description: If the specified bucket does not exist, returns an error message indicating that the bucket was not found.

put.summary: Uploads a file to the specified Amazon S3-compatible bucket using HTTP PUT method.
put.description:
This endpoint allows clients to upload a file to the specified Amazon S3-compatible bucket using HTTP PUT method. 
The uploaded file is identified by the specified bucket name and key, and the metadata can be specified using the meta parameter.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the Amazon S3-compatible bucket to upload the file to.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key used to identify the file in the bucket.

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to additional metadata Example values;
Content-Writer,
Project-Name,
OTHER

200.description: Returns a success response if the file is successfully uploaded.

404.description: If the specified bucket does not exist, returns an error message indicating that the bucket was not found.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Operation such as add/update/delete

parameters.name: systemName
parameters.description: Name of the service (etc. mail, sms, notification)

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Name of the resource

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the resource

requestBody.description: JSON information about the Data that will be used to fill message template

post.summary: This endpoint creates a Task in FHIR with the specified values from the provided taskValues.
post.description:
ScheduledFor value is not important, it is only checked if its == 0 or not.
	Will create a Task, even if validation of taskValues fail.
	In that case, Task status will be set to "failed".

parameters.name: scheduledFor
parameters.description: This will be used to determine if Task will be scheduled or not.

requestBody.description: The contents of the Task that will be created.

put.summary: This endpoint updates a Task in FHIR with the specified values from the provided taskValues.
put.description: "status" and "details" fields of Task expected to be updated.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The ID of the Task to be updated.

requestBody.description: The contents of the Task that will be updated.

status.description: The status property of the response.

title.description: The title property of the response.

responseCode.description: The numeric code property of the response.

errorType.description: The property that holds the type of the error.

details.description: The property that holds the details about the error.

traceId.description: The property that holds the trace id of the error.

instance.description: The property that holds the instance of the error.

ErrorResponse.description:
This class represents an error response model, it inherits from the BaseResponseModel class and it's used to create
an error response with a status code, an instance, a title, and details about the error.

xmlPath.description: Gets or sets the file path of the e-smm XML.

SendEsmm.description: Represents the request model for sending an e-smm.

status.description: The status of the invoice response (e.g. "KABUL", "RED").

invoiceId.description: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the invoice associated with the response.

description.description: An array of descriptions providing additional information or reasons for the invoice response status.

SendInvoiceResponseModel.description: Represents the information required for sending an invoice response.

status.description: The status property of the response.

title.description: The title property of the response.

responseCode.description: The numeric code property of the response.

SuccessResponse.description:
This class represents a success response model, it inherits from the BaseResponseModel and it's used to create a
success response.

bucketName.description: Gets or sets the name of the storage bucket.

key.description: Gets or sets the Key or path of the file in the storage system.

data.description: Gets or sets the base64-encoded string representation of the file's binary Data.

contentType.description: Gets or sets the content type of the file.

UploadFileModel.description: Represents a model for uploading a file to a storage system.

oauth2.description: Standard Authorization header using the Bearer scheme ("bearer {token}")
oauth2.name: Authorization
